titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1828 Oct. 24 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1828 Oct. 24
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This is from the Friday October 24, 1828 session of court, during which two criminal cases were heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: October & November Term 1828
Friday 24th
div1.p: The Court met and formed a quoram Present Andrew Ross, John Huss, and Walter L. Adair Judges
The Court have duly elected Elijah Hicks clerk of said Court.

The Cherokee Nation
vs
Robert Saunders
& Wayahuttah

The Nation
Chee, wo, Rul, lerpro.
vs
Beaver Carrier
Court find the deft. Beaver Carrier guilty and sentence him to twenty five lashes-
and give him judgment in favour of the prosecutor ten dollars & Costs-
The Court adjourned till 10 Oclock tomorrow-
